resources.string: Account details will be sent to your email address
You should spend at least 5 minutes on this warm-up routine. You may warm up for longer if you want.\n\nStart off marching on the spot and then march forwards and backwards.
Keep marching and start rolling your shoulders.\nRoll your shoulders forwards five times and backwards five times, then repeat one more time.\nLet your arms hang loose by your sides.

Next, do a quad stretch - grasp your ankle and gently pull your heel up and back until you feel a stretch in the front of your thigh.\nStand tall, keep knees together and avoid leaning to the side.\nKeep a slight bend in the supporting leg.
Next, stretch your chest - clasp hands behind your back with palms facing up.\nPull hands down and try to bring shoulder blades together.\nYour chest should stick out. Do not arch your back.

Next, do an upper back stretch - round the back, extend arms in front of you. Clasp hands together, palms facing in.\nDrop your head.\nFocus on increasing the gap between your hands and chest, feeling your shoulders stretching across your back.

Finally, do the tricep stretch - place your hand on your upper back with the elbow bend upwards. Use other hand to pull the elbow towards your head to feel the stretch.\nDo not hold the elbow joint and do not arch your back. Repeat with the other arm.

Suggested number of reps: 20 

Take a prone position on the floor or other rigid surface that's able to support your body weight.
Keep your feet together!
Position hands palms-down on the floor, approximately shoulder width apart.\nRaise yourself using your arms then lower your torso to the ground until your elbows form a 90 degree angle.

Suggested number of reps: 20 

Lie on your back on the floor and bend your knees.
Your feet can be flat on the floor, or you can keep them suspended in the air during your crunches for a little extra crunch.
Cross your arms in front of your chest.\nYour head and neck should be resting on your hands.
Curl your back to lift your shoulders towards the ceiling (not towards your knees) using strictly your abdominal muscles.

Suggested number of reps: 20 

Set your legs apart, while keeping your weight on your heels.
Keep your chest up!
Gradually push your hips back towards the floor.\nYour hips should move before your knees bend.\nWedge your elbows in between your knees at the bottom point of the movement.
Initiate the second part of the move by driving your hips forward to return to the start position
Suggested number of reps: 15–20\n\nStart with your body flat on your back.
Stretch your hands backwards and raise your feet 6 inches(15cm) from the ground.

Begin by gradually bringing your arms forward towards your knee and at the same time raise your legs up to a 45 degree angle.\nSlowly return both hands and legs to the start position and repeat this for the required sets.

Suggested number of reps: 10–20 

Begin with a hands and knees position with your toes pointed toward the floor.
Bring your left knee forward and place it on the floor under your chest.
Lift your right knee off the ground, making your right leg straight and strong
Keeping your hands firmly on the ground, jump to switch leg positions.
Now your left leg should be fully extended while your right knee is placed under your chest, and your hands firmly on the ground.\nMake sure to maintain your body weight on both legs.
Suggested number of reps: 15 \n\nCome to a hands and knees position (quadruped) on the ground with your hands directly under your shoulders, fingers facing forward, and knees under your hips.
Reach one leg out and away followed by the other leg, bringing you to a plank position.\nYour head should be aligned with your spine.
Slowly bend the elbows, lowering your body toward the floor.\nKeep your head aligned with your spine.\nDo not allow your low back or ribcage to sag or your hips to hike upward.

Straighten the elbows, pressing upward through your arms.\nAs you straighten the arms, lift your left foot off the floor, keeping the knee straight.\nContinue pressing until the elbows are straight and your left leg is off the floor.
Hold this position briefly before returning to your starting position.\nRepeat the push up alternating legs with each repetition.

Suggested number of reps: 10

Lie down on your back on a flat surface. Put the soles of your feet together with your knees pointing out to the sides, so your kneecaps are as far away from one another as they can be.
Pull your feet towards your torso, keeping your feet centered and together at the soles.
Stretch your arms straight in front of your chest towards the ceiling. Straighten your elbows and clasp your hands together.

Bring your clasped hands slowly to rest on the floor behind your head. Try to touch the ground, but keep your arms straight.\nIf your arms bend as you approach the floor, start over and stop above the ground just before your arms begin to bend.

Bring your hands back to their original positions, then repeat.\nContinue these overhead and pullback motions for however long you like, keeping your limbs controlled and moving smoothly throughout the exercise.

Suggested number of reps: 20
Pre-requisite: a stability ball or a big pillow

Begin this with your body directly on top of the ball. The ball should be placed beneath your abdomen, the stretch your legs on the floor. Take a few deep breaths before you start.
Try to gently squeeze the ball between your hands to create more strength and stability.
Slowly press your body upward until your elbows are straight.\nKeep your body straight for a few seconds and then return to the start position.

Do you want to exercise or look up a diet?
Which of these foods is the richest in Calcium? (It keeps your bones and teeth strong)
How much weight does water make up in our bodies?
What is the recommended consumption of calories per day for an average human?
What Vitamin helps the body to recover faster from wounds and boosts the immune system?
Which have the most Vitamin C?
Which one has the most protein?
Which Vitamin does not only help with vision, but also helps synthesis protein?
Which is the richest in Vitamin A?
Which of these have the most Zinc? (Important for growth, taste, smell, vision and the immune system)
Which of these has the highest Cholesterol and should be consumed in moderate amounts?
Which way of cooking eggs is the least healthy one?
Which nutrient is the most important source of energy in exercises with high intensity?
D) All the above in equal parts
How should a sports drink NOT be?
How many litres of water per day is it recommended to drink for an average human?
Which element transports oxygen in blood?
Which of these has the highest amount of Iron in it?
Which is the richest in Vitamin B12? (It improves your memory!)
Which Vitamin helps to maintain cell membranes which are essential for growth of muscle cells?
Which food has the highest Vitamin E content? (It keeps your skin, heart and circulation, nerves, muscles and red blood cells healthy)
Which is worse: over-sleeping or under-sleeping?
Which Vitamin is crucial for the absorption of Calcium and Phosphorus?
Which of these foods has the most vitamin D in it?
Which Mineral’s main role is to produce energy and synthesize proteins? It can often be found in bran products (e.g. Rice, Oat)
People who are exposed to normal quantities of sunlight do not usually need supplements of Vitamin …
How much overweight will result in many more health problems comparing to being normal weight?
What contains the most Magnesium? (Helps to maintain normal muscle and nerve function, keeps bones and immune system strong)
Which Mineral is required to help keep your cells, bones and teeth healthy?
Which food contains the most Phosphorus?
Why is it required to consume proteins when body building?
B) It creates individual amino acids
Adults (18 and over) need 30 minutes of physical activity of five or more days a week to be healthy; children and teens need 60 minutes of activity a day for their health.
Thirty of activity broken into smaller segments of 10 or 15 minutes throughout the day have significant health benefits.
Did you know that the amount of saliva produced in a healthy person per day is on average 0.75–1.5 litres per day?
If all 600 muscles in the body pulled in one direction, you could lift around 25 tons.
Did you know that exercise increases energy levels and increases serotonin in the brain, which leads to improved mental clarity?
69 percent of people consider themselves to be physically fit, but only 13 percent are actually physically fit
Did you know that the surface of the human intestine is around 600 square meters?
The sound you hear when you crack your knuckles is actually the sound of nitrogen gas bubbles bursting.
Did you know that you can lose one hundred and fifty calories if you bang your head on a wall for an hour?
It is harder to put on 4.5 kg of muscle than it is to lose 4.5kg of fat!
Did you know that after eating too much, your hearing is less sharp?
Your heart pumps about 9000 litres of blood each day!
Did you know that when you take a step, you are using up to 200 muscles?
It is impossible to tickle yourself!
Did you know that you can lose weight and still gain muscle? Likewise, you can also gain weight while still losing fat.
For the average adult human, the skin has a surface area of between 1.5–2.0 square metres
Did you know that the heart is the strongest muscle of the body and beats around 100,000 times a day?
Eating at night does not make you fat – overeating does.
Did you know that the average human body contains enough fat to make around seven bars of soap?
When you smile you use up to 17 muscles, while frowning you use 43.
Did you know that you cannot sneeze with your eyes open?
It’s hard to believe, but a caterpillar has more muscles than you do!
Did you know that the tongue is one of the strongest muscles of human body along with the heart?
Healthy human bones are stronger than concrete!
Did you know that a sneeze travels at over 160 kilometres per hour?
Most people cannot lick their own elbows!
Did you know that your nose can remember up to 50,000 different scents?
The surface area of a human lung is equal to a tennis court!
Yawning helps you cool your brain. It is an involuntary behaviour. When you yawn, the influx of cool air may ventilate your sinuses and facilitate brain cooling.
It is impossible to swallow and breathe at the same time. However, babies can do this but until they are about nine months.
Did you know that in 30 minutes, the average body gives off enough heat (combined) to bring 2 litres of water to boil?
The average human body contains enough iron to make a small nail!

The Android application "Minitrainer" is provided as is and the user shall install and use the application at his/her own risk.

All direct, indirect, incidental or punitive damages arising from use of the "Minitrainer" application or the data herin are disclaimed and excluded. The developers of this application accept no liability arising from the use of the "Minitrainer" application.

Using this application is no guarantee that the users lifestyle will improve and/or become healthier as a result. This application is to be used as a supplement to a balanced and healthy lifestyle followed under advice from a registered healthcare provider.

This application is not intended nor does it claim to replace professional medical advice.
Information contained within the application is provided for general education purposes only and users should not rely solely on the accuracy of the application or data provided within.

If you are unsure as to the effects of following advice contained within the application, you are urged to contact your healthcare provider or other relevant professional medical advice.

Please consult your healthcare provider before making any lifestyle changes or if you have any health concerns or questions.
